[[File:HeinrichTimerdingPortrait.jpg|thumb]]
'''Heinrich Carl Franz Emil Timerding''' (23 Jan. 1873 in [[Strasbourg]]<ref name="Rehbock.1943">{{cite journal | author=Fritz Rehbock | title=Heinrich Timerding | journal=[[Deutsche Mathematik]] | volume=7 | number=2/3 | pages=252—254 | date=Jul 1943 }} (On the occasion of his 70th birthday)</ref> – 1945 in [[Braunschweig]]) was a German [[mathematician]], professor at the [[Braunschweig University of Technology]], mainly known for his contributions to [[probability theory]].
He was awarded the [[War Merit Cross (Brunswick)|Brunswick]] and the Prussian [[War Merit Cross]], the Ritterkreuz ([[Knight's Cross]]) of the [[Order of Henry the Lion]], and in 1938 the Nazi [[Civil Service Faithful Service Medal]].<ref name="Rehbock.1943"/>

==Main publications==

* ''[https://archive.org/details/geometriederkrf00timegoog Geometrie der Kräfte]'', Teubner, Leipzig 1908
* ''Die Erziehung der Anschauung'', Teubner, Leipzig, 1912
* ''Handbuch der angewandten Mathematik Vol. 1. Praktische Analysis.  Vol. 2. Darstellende Geometrie.'', Teubner 1914
* ''Analyse des Zufalls'', 1915,
* ''Der goldene Schnitt'', 1919
* '' Robert Mayer und die Entdeckung des Energiegesetzes'', 1925.

==References==
* ''One Hundred Years of l’Enseignement Mathematique'', Moments of Mathematics Education in the Twentieth Century, Geneva 2003 [http://www.unige.ch/math/EnsMath/EM-ICMI/ACTGE.pdf]
* Walter Kertz, ''Technische Universität Braunschweig vom Collegium Carolinum zur Technischen Universität 1745 – 1995'', Hildesheim 1995 
* Wolfgang Schneider, ''Die Technische Hochschule Braunschweig; Länderdienst'', Verlag Berlin-West, Basel 1963
* Anders Hald, ''A history of mathematical statistics from 1750 to 1930'', 1998 (ISBN 0471179124)
